property.name: text
property.value: Author: Chadlia Jerad Based on GenerateHueAccessor by Christopher Brooks

property.name: text
property.value:
This model reads from the lifxs.json file the Lifx mac addresses and their corresponding atag.
After running Lifx discovery, the bulbs (identified through their macAddresses) will have their corrsponding ipAddress and port number
The model generates accessors that are added to the key-value store. The '@macAddress@', '@ipAddress'@ and '@port@' strings are respectiveley substituted with the macAddress, ipAddress and port from the previous step.
Click on the link below to open the template:

property.name: _windowProperties
property.value: {bounds={856, 415, 499, 189}, maximized=false}

property.name: script
note
property.value: NOTE: To see the script, invoke Open Actor

property.name: description
property.value:
This accessor reads or writes data to a key-value store web service whenever it receives a trigger input. A URL for the service is specified by the storeLocation parameter. A Ptolemy II model that provides such a key-value store service can be found at https://www.icyphy.org/accessors/demo/KeyValueStore/KeyValueStoreServer.xml. A demo client that uses this accessor is provided at https://www.icyphy.org/accessors/demo/KeyValueStore/KeyValueStoreClient.xml.

The key and the value are both text items provided as inputs. If remove is true and the key is non-empty, then upon firing, this actor will remove the specified key from the store, producing on its output the previous value (if any). If remove is false, then this actor will either set or retrieve a value in the key-value store, depending on whether the and the value input is non-empty. If the value is non-empty, then this actor sets the value. If it is empty, then this actor retrieves the value.

If an error occurs accessing the key-value store (e.g., no store is found at the specified URL, or no value is found with the specified key), then an exception is thrown.

This accessor assumes that the protocol implemented at that location matches the specification below for the default location:

  • To store a value with key MY_ID and value MY_VALUE, use

    http://localhost:8077/keyvalue/set?id=MY_ID&value=MY_VALUE

  • To retrieve the value, use

    http://localhost:8077/keyvalue/get?id=MY_ID

  • To remove a value, use

    http://localhost:8077/keyvalue/delete?id=MY_ID

    The key and value are both encoded using the JavaScript encodeURIComponent() function, and on retrieval, decoded using decodeURIComponent(), and hence can include any text characters.

    Note that this accessor uses blocking reads to access the store, so if the store is remote, this could lead to sluggish responses.

property.name: author
property.value: Edward A. Lee

property.name: version
property.value: $$Id: KeyValueStore.js 2167 2017-09-27 15:54:04Z cxh $$

property.name: storeLocation (port)
property.value: The URL of the key-value store service.

property.name: key (port)
property.value: The key to be updated or retrieved.

property.name: remove (port)
property.value: If true, then remove the key from the store; otherwise, retrieve the value for the key.

property.name: value (port)
property.value: The value to store in the key-value store, or empty to not store anything.

property.name: result (port)
property.value: The value retrieved from or written to the key-value store.

property.name: trigger (port)
property.value: The trigger input.

property.name: description
property.value: Test accessor that spontaneously produces outputs once per time interval. This implementation produces a counting sequence.

property.name: author
property.value: Christopher Brooks and Edward A. Lee. Based on TestSpontaneous by Edward A. Lee

property.name: version
property.value: $$Id: TestSpontaneousOnce.js 1659 2017-05-09 14:26:57Z cxh $$

property.name: output (port)
property.value: The output port

property.name: delay (parameter)
property.value: The delay in milliseconds before the value is outputk.

property.name: value (parameter)
property.value: The value to be output after the delay.
